article: Once a circle lost one of its wedges . The circle wanted to be _ , so it went around looking for its missing piece. But _ it was incomplete and therefore could roll only very _ , it admired the flowers along the way. It chatted with worms. It enjoyed the sunshine. It found lots of _ pieces, but none of them fit. So it _ them all by the side of the road and kept on _ . Then one day the circle found a piece that fit _ . It was so happy. Now it could be whole, with _ missing. It incorporated the missing piece into itself and began to _ . Now that it was a perfect _ , it could roll very fast, _ fast to notice flowers or talk to the worms. When it _ how different the world seemed when it rolled so quickly, it _ , left its found piece by the side of the road and rolled slowly away. The _ of the story is that in some strange sense we are more whole when we are lacking in something. The man who has everything is in some ways a _ man. He will never know what it feels like to hope, and to nourish his soul with the _ of something better. He will never get the _ of having someone who loves him give him something he has always wanted or _ had. When we _ that imperfection is part of being human, and when we can continue rolling through life and _ it, we will have achieved a wholeness that others can only long for.
